<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Adam Stokes <adam.stokes@ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>sosreport</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>3.2+git276-g7da50d6-3ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Set of tools to gather troubleshooting data from a system
 Sos is a set of tools that gathers information about system
 hardware and configuration. The information can then be used for
 diagnostic purposes and debugging. Sos is commonly used to help
 support technicians and developers.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>1148</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>squashfs-tools</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1:4.3-3ubuntu2</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Tool to create and append to squashfs filesystems
 Squashfs is a highly compressed read-only filesystem for Linux. It uses zlib
 compression to compress both files, inodes and directories. Inodes in the
 system are very small and all blocks are packed to minimise data overhead.
 Block sizes greater than 4K are supported up to a maximum of 64K.
 .
 Squashfs is intended for general read-only filesystem use, for archival use
 (i.e. in cases where a .tar.gz file may be used), and in constrained block
 device/memory systems (e.g. embedded systems) where low overhead is needed.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>292</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Dustin Kirkland <kirkland@ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>ssh-import-id</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>5.5-0ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>securely retrieve an SSH public key and install it locally
 This utility will securely contact a public keyserver (Launchpad.net by
 default, but Github.com is also supported), retrieve one or more user's
 public keys, and append these to the current user's ~/.ssh/authorized_keys
 file.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>51</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>strace</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>4.11-1ubuntu3</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>System call tracer
 strace is a system call tracer, i.e. a debugging tool which prints out
 a trace of all the system calls made by a another process/program.
 The program to be traced need not be recompiled for this, so you can
 use it on binaries for which you don't have source.
 .
 System calls and signals are events that happen at the user/kernel
 interface. A close examination of this boundary is very useful for bug
 isolation, sanity checking and attempting to capture race conditions.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>892</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>sudo</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.8.16-0ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Provide limited super user privileges to specific users
 Sudo is a program designed to allow a sysadmin to give limited root
 privileges to users and log root activity. The basic philosophy is to give
 as few privileges as possible but still allow people to get their work done.
 .
 This version is built with minimal shared library dependencies, use the
 sudo-ldap package instead if you need LDAP support for sudoers.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>1580</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>systemd</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>229-4ubuntu4</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>system and service manager
 systemd is a system and service manager for Linux. It provides aggressive
 parallelization capabilities, uses socket and D-Bus activation for starting
 services, offers on-demand starting of daemons, keeps track of processes
 using Linux control groups, supports snapshotting and restoring of the system
 state, maintains mount and automount points and implements an elaborate
 transactional dependency-based service control logic.
 .
 systemd is compatible with SysV and LSB init scripts and can work as a
 drop-in replacement for sysvinit.
 .
 Installing the systemd package will not switch your init system unless you
 boot with init=/bin/systemd or install systemd-sysv in addition.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>18776</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>systemd-sysv</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>229-4ubuntu4</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>system and service manager - SysV links
 systemd is a system and service manager for Linux. It provides aggressive
 parallelization capabilities, uses socket and D-Bus activation for starting
 services, offers on-demand starting of daemons, keeps track of processes
 using Linux control groups, supports snapshotting and restoring of the system
 state, maintains mount and automount points and implements an elaborate
 transactional dependency-based service control logic.
 .
 systemd is compatible with SysV and LSB init scripts and can work as a
 drop-in replacement for sysvinit.
 .
 This package provides the manual pages and links needed for systemd
 to replace sysvinit. Installing systemd-sysv will overwrite /sbin/init with a
 link to systemd.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>90</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>sysv-rc</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2.88dsf-59.3ubuntu2</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>System-V-like runlevel change mechanism
 This package provides support for the System-V like system
 for booting, changing runlevels, and shutting down,
 configured through symbolic links in /etc/rc?.d/.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>127</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>sysvinit-utils</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2.88dsf-59.3ubuntu2</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>System-V-like utilities
 This package contains the important System-V-like utilities.
 .
 Specifically, this package includes:
 killall5, pidof</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>124</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>tar</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.28-2.1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>GNU version of the tar archiving utility
 Tar is a program for packaging a set of files as a single archive in tar
 format. The function it performs is conceptually similar to cpio, and to
 things like PKZIP in the DOS world. It is heavily used by the Debian package
 management system, and is useful for performing system backups and exchanging
 sets of files with others.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>804</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>tcpd</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>7.6.q-25</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Wietse Venema's TCP wrapper utilities
 Wietse Venema's network logger, also known as TCPD or LOG_TCP.
 .
 These programs log the client host name of incoming telnet,
 ftp, rsh, rlogin, finger etc. requests.
 .
 Security options are:
 - access control per host, domain and/or service;
 - detection of host name spoofing or host address spoofing;
 - booby traps to implement an early-warning system.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>111</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>tcpdump</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>4.7.4-1ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>command-line network traffic analyzer
 This program allows you to dump the traffic on a network. tcpdump
 is able to examine IPv4, ICMPv4, IPv6, ICMPv6, UDP, TCP, SNMP, AFS
 BGP, RIP, PIM, DVMRP, IGMP, SMB, OSPF, NFS and many other packet
 types.
 .
 It can be used to print out the headers of packets on a network
 interface, filter packets that match a certain expression. You can
 use this tool to track down network problems, to detect attacks
 or to monitor network activities.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>1181</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>telnet</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>0.17-40</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>basic telnet client
 The telnet command is used for interactive communication with another host
 using the TELNET protocol.
 .
 For the purpose of remote login, the present client executable should be
 depreciated in favour of an ssh-client, or in some cases with variants like
 telnet-ssl or Kerberized TELNET clients. The most important reason is that
 this implementation exchanges user name and password in clear text.
 .
 On the other hand, the present program does satisfy common use cases of
 network diagnostics, like protocol testing of SMTP services, so it can
 become handy enough.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>178</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Colin King <colin.king@canonical.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>thermald</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.5-2ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Thermal monitoring and controlling daemon
 Thermal Daemon is a Linux daemon for monitoring and
 controlling platform temperatures. Once the system
 temperature reaches a certain threshold, the Linux daemon
 activates various cooling methods to try to cool the system.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>572</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>time</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.7-25.1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>GNU time program for measuring CPU resource usage
 The 'time' command runs another program, then displays information
 about the resources used by that program, collected by the system while
 the program was running. You can select which information is reported
 and the format in which it is shown, or have 'time' save the information
 in a file instead of display it on the screen.
 .
 The resources that 'time' can report on fall into the general
 categories of time, memory, I/O, and IPC calls.
 .
 The GNU version can format the output in arbitrary ways by using a
 printf-style format string to include various resource measurements.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>106</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>tmux</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2.1-3build1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>terminal multiplexer
 tmux enables a number of terminals (or windows) to be accessed and
 controlled from a single terminal like screen. tmux runs as a
 server-client system. A server is created automatically when necessary
 and holds a number of sessions, each of which may have a number of
 windows linked to it. Any number of clients may connect to a session,
 or the server may be controlled by issuing commands with tmux.
 Communication takes place through a socket, by default placed in /tmp.
 Moreover tmux provides a consistent and well-documented command
 interface, with the same syntax whether used interactively, as a key
 binding, or from the shell. It offers a choice of vim or Emacs key
 layouts.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>587</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>tree</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.7.0-3</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>displays an indented directory tree, in color
 Tree is a recursive directory listing command that produces a depth indented
 listing of files, which is colorized ala dircolors if the LS_COLORS environment
 variable is set and output is to tty.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>135</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>tzdata</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2016d-0ubuntu0.16.04</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>time zone and daylight-saving time data
 This package contains data required for the implementation of

 globe. It is updated periodically to reflect changes made by
 political bodies to time zone boundaries, UTC offsets, and
 daylight-saving rules.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>2769</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>ubuntu-cloudimage-keyring</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2013.11.11</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>GnuPG keys of the Ubuntu Cloud Image builder

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>ubuntu-minimal</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.361</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Minimal core of Ubuntu

 that is a functional command-line system with the following capabilities:
 .

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>ubuntu-standard</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.361</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>The Ubuntu standard system
 This package depends on all of the packages in the Ubuntu standard system.
 This set of packages provides a comfortable command-line Unix-like
 environment.
 .
 It is also used to help ensure proper upgrades, so it is recommended that
 it not be removed.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>45</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>ucf</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>3.0036</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Update Configuration File(s): preserve user changes to config files
 Debian policy mandates that user changes to configuration files must be
 preserved during package upgrades. The easy way to achieve this behavior
 is to make the configuration file a 'conffile', in which case dpkg
 handles the file specially during upgrades, prompting the user as
 needed.
 .
 This is appropriate only if it is possible to distribute a default
 version that will work for most installations, although some system
 administrators may choose to modify it. This implies that the
 default version will be part of the package distribution, and must
 not be modified by the maintainer scripts during installation (or at
 any other time).
 .
 This script attempts to provide conffile-like handling for files that
 may not be labelled conffiles, and are not shipped in a Debian package,
 but handled by the postinst instead. This script allows one to
 maintain files in /etc, preserving user changes and in general
 offering the same facilities while upgrading that dpkg normally
 provides for 'conffiles'.
 .
 Additionally, this script provides facilities for transitioning a
 file that had not been provided with conffile-like protection to come
 under this schema, and attempts to minimize questions asked at
 installation time. Indeed, the transitioning facility is better than the
 one offered by dpkg while transitioning a file from a non-conffile to
 conffile status.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>191</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>udev</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>229-4ubuntu4</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>/dev/ and hotplug management daemon
 udev is a daemon which dynamically creates and removes device nodes from
 /dev/, handles hotplug events and loads drivers at boot time.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>6720</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Jamie Strandboge <jamie@ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>ufw</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>0.35-0ubuntu2</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>program for managing a Netfilter firewall
 The Uncomplicated FireWall is a front-end for iptables, to make managing a

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>unattended-upgrades</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>0.90</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>automatic installation of security upgrades
 This package can download and install security upgrades automatically
 and unattended, taking care to only install packages from the
 configured APT source, and checking for dpkg prompts about
 configuration file changes.
 .
 This script is the backend for the APT::Periodic::Unattended-Upgrade
 option.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>304</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>unscd</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>0.52-1build1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Micro Name Service Caching Daemon
 A daemon which handles passwd, group and host lookups for running
 programs and caches the results for the next query. You only need
 this package if you are using slow Name Services like LDAP, NIS or
 NIS+.
 .
 This particular NSCD is a complete rewrite of the GNU glibc nscd
 which is a single threaded server process which offloads all NSS
 lookups to worker children; cache hits are handled by the parent,
 and only cache misses start worker children, making the parent immune
 to resource leaks, hangs, and crashes in NSS libraries.
 .
 It should mostly be a drop-in replacement for existing installs using
 nscd.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>67</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>unzip</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>6.0-20ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>De-archiver for .zip files
 InfoZIP's unzip program. With the exception of multi-volume archives
 (ie, .ZIP files that are split across several disks using PKZIP's /& option),
 this can handle any file produced either by PKZIP, or the corresponding
 InfoZIP zip program.

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Scott James Remnant <scott@ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>ureadahead</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>0.100.0-19</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Read required files in advance
 ber-readahead is used during boot to read files in advance of when
 they are needed such that they are already in the page cache,
 improving boot performance.
 .
 Its data files are regenerated on the first boot after install, and
 either monthly thereafter or when packages with init scripts or
 configs are installed or updated.
 .
 ureadahead requires a kernel patch included in the Ubuntu kernel.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>127</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>usbutils</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1:007-4</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Linux USB utilities
 This package contains the lsusb utility for inspecting the devices

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>util-linux</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2.27.1-6ubuntu3</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>miscellaneous system utilities
 This package contains a number of important utilities, most of which
 are oriented towards maintenance of your system. Some of the more
 important utilities included in this package allow you to partition
 your hard disk, view kernel messages, and create new filesystems.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>3237</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>uuid-runtime</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2.27.1-6ubuntu3</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>runtime components for the Universally Unique ID library
 The libuuid library generates and parses 128-bit Universally Unique
 IDs (UUIDs). A UUID is an identifier that is unique within the space
 of all such identifiers across both space and time. It can be used for
 multiple purposes, from tagging objects with an extremely short lifetime
 to reliably identifying very persistent objects across a network.
 .
 See RFC 4122 for more information.
 .
 This package contains the uuidgen program and the uuidd daemon.
 .
 The uuidd daemon is used to generate UUIDs, especially time-based
 UUIDs, in a secure and guaranteed-unique fashion, even in the face of
 large numbers of threads trying to grab UUIDs running on different CPUs.
 It is used by libuuid as well as the uuidgen program.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>154</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>vim</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Vi IMproved - enhanced vi editor
 Vim is an almost compatible version of the UNIX editor Vi.
 .
 Many new features have been added: multi level undo, syntax
 highlighting, command line history, on-line help, filename
 completion, block operations, folding, Unicode support, etc.
 .
 This package contains a version of vim compiled with a rather
 standard set of features. This package does not provide a GUI
 version of Vim. See the other vim-* packages if you need more
 (or less).</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>2321</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>vim-common</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Vi IMproved - Common files
 Vim is an almost compatible version of the UNIX editor Vi.
 .
 This package contains files shared by all non GUI-enabled vim variants
 available in Debian. Examples of such shared files are: manpages,
 common executables like xxd, and configuration files.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>367</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>vim-runtime</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Vi IMproved - Runtime files
 Vim is an almost compatible version of the UNIX editor Vi.
 .
 This package contains vimtutor and the architecture independent runtime
 files, used, if available, by all vim variants available in Debian.
 Example of such runtime files are: online documentation, rules for
 language-specific syntax highlighting and indentation, color schemes,
 and standard plugins.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>26869</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>vim-tiny</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Vi IMproved - enhanced vi editor - compact version
 Vim is an almost compatible version of the UNIX editor Vi.
 .
 This package contains a minimal version of Vim compiled with no GUI and
 a small subset of features. This package's sole purpose is to provide
 the vi binary for base installations.
 .
 If a vim binary is wanted, try one of the following more featureful
 packages: vim, vim-nox, vim-athena, vim-gtk, vim-gtk3, or vim-gnome.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>1071</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>vlan</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.9-3.2ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>user mode programs to enable VLANs on your ethernet devices
 This package contains the user mode programs you need to add and remove
 VLAN devices from your ethernet devices.
 .
 A typical application for a VLAN enabled box is a single wire firewall,
 router or load balancer.
 .
 You need a VLAN Linux kernel for this. Linux kernel versions >= 2.4.14
 have VLAN support.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>160</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>wget</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.17.1-1ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>retrieves files from the web
 Wget is a network utility to retrieve files from the web
 using HTTP(S) and FTP, the two most widely used internet
 protocols. It works non-interactively, so it will work in
 the background, after having logged off. The program supports
 recursive retrieval of web-authoring pages as well as FTP
 sites -- you can use Wget to make mirrors of archives and
 home pages or to travel the web like a WWW robot.
 .
 Wget works particularly well with slow or unstable connections
 by continuing to retrieve a document until the document is fully
 downloaded. Re-getting files from where it left off works on
 servers (both HTTP and FTP) that support it. Both HTTP and FTP
 retrievals can be time stamped, so Wget can see if the remote
 file has changed since the last retrieval and automatically
 retrieve the new version if it has.
 .
 Wget supports proxy servers; this can lighten the network load,
 speed up retrieval, and provide access behind firewalls.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>876</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>whiptail</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>0.52.18-1ubuntu2</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Displays user-friendly dialog boxes from shell scripts
 Whiptail is a "dialog" replacement using newt instead of ncurses. It
 provides a method of displaying several different types of dialog boxes
 from shell scripts. This allows a developer of a script to interact with
 the user in a much friendlier manner.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>63</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>wireless-regdb</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2015.07.20-1ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>wireless regulatory database
 This package contains the wireless regulatory database used by the Central
 Regulatory Database Agent (CRDA) to configure wireless devices to operate
 within the radio spectrum allowed in the local jurisdiction.
 .
 This regulatory information is provided with no warranty either expressed or
 implied. Only Linux drivers which use cfg80211 framework can make use of the
 regulatory database and CRDA.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>26</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>xauth</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1:1.0.9-1ubuntu2</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>X authentication utility
 xauth is a small utility to read and manipulate Xauthority files, which
 are used by servers and clients alike to control authentication and access
 to X sessions.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>86</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>xdg-user-dirs</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>0.15-2ubuntu6</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>tool to manage well known user directories
 xdg-user-dirs is a tool to help manage "well known" user directories
 like the desktop folder and the music folder. It also handles
 localization (i.e. translation) of the filenames.
 .
 The way it works is that xdg-user-dirs-update is run very early in the
 login phase. This program reads a configuration file, and a set of
 default directories. It then creates localized versions of these
 directories in the users home directory and sets up a config file in
 $(XDG_CONFIG_HOME)/user-dirs.dirs (XDG_CONFIG_HOME defaults to
 ~/.config) that applications can read to find these directories.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>538</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>xfsprogs</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>4.3.0+nmu1ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Utilities for managing the XFS filesystem
 A set of commands to use the XFS filesystem, including mkfs.xfs.
 .
 XFS is a high performance journaling filesystem which originated
 on the SGI IRIX platform. It is completely multi-threaded, can
 support large files and large filesystems, extended attributes,
 variable block sizes, is extent based, and makes extensive use of
 Btrees (directories, extents, free space) to aid both performance
 and scalability.
 .
 Refer to the documentation at http://oss.sgi.com/projects/xfs/
 for complete details.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>3332</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu X-SWAT <ubuntu-x@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>xkb-data</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>2.16-1ubuntu1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>X Keyboard Extension (XKB) configuration data
 This package contains configuration data used by the X Keyboard
 Extension (XKB), which allows selection of keyboard layouts when
 using a graphical interface.
 .
 Every X11 vendor provides its own XKB data files, so keyboard layout
 designers have to send their layouts to several places. The
 xkeyboard-config project has been launched at FreeDesktop in order
 to provide a central repository that could be used by all vendors.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>2995</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>xml-core</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>0.13+nmu2</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>all</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>XML infrastructure and XML catalog file support
 This package creates the XML infrastructure directories and provides
 XML catalog file support in compliance with the current Debian XML
 Policy draft:
 .
 * infrastructure directories:
 - /etc/xml
 - /usr/share/xml/{declaration,entities,misc,schema}
 - /usr/local/share/xml/{declaration,entities,misc,schema}
 .
 * XML catalog schema: OASIS XML Catalog Committee Specification 1.0
 .
 * update-xmlcatalog(8): tool for maintaining the root XML catalog
 file and the package XML catalog files in the '/etc/xml' directory
 as well as local XML catalog files.
 .
 * dh_installxmlcatalogs(1): debhelper tool for installing local XML
 catalog files and registering XML entities in package XML catalog
 files and the root XML catalog file (requires debhelper package)</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>188</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>xz-utils</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>5.1.1alpha+20120614-2ubuntu2</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>XZ-format compression utilities
 XZ is the successor to the Lempel-Ziv/Markov-chain Algorithm
 compression format, which provides memory-hungry but powerful
 compression (often better than bzip2) and fast, easy decompression.
 .
 This package provides the command line tools for working with XZ
 compression, including xz, unxz, xzcat, xzgrep, and so on. They can
 also handle the older LZMA format, and if invoked via appropriate
 symlinks will emulate the behavior of the commands in the lzma
 package.
 .
 The XZ format is similar to the older LZMA format but includes some
 improvements for general use:
 .
 * 'file' magic for detecting XZ files;
 * crc64 data integrity check;
 * limited random-access reading support;
 * improved support for multithreading (not used in xz-utils);
 * support for flushing the encoder.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>384</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>zerofree</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1.0.3-1</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>zero free blocks from ext2, ext3 and ext4 file-systems
 Zerofree finds the unallocated blocks with non-zero value content in
 an ext2, ext3 or ext4 file-system and fills them with zeroes
 (zerofree can also work with another value than zero). This is mostly
 useful if the device on which this file-system resides is a disk
 image. In this case, depending on the type of disk image, a secondary
 utility may be able to reduce the size of the disk image after
 zerofree has been run. Zerofree requires the file-system to be
 unmounted or mounted read-only.
 .
 The usual way to achieve the same result (zeroing the unused
 blocks) is to run "dd" to create a file full of zeroes that takes up
 the entire free space on the drive, and then delete this file. This
 has many disadvantages, which zerofree alleviates:
 * it is slow;
 * it makes the disk image (temporarily) grow to its maximal extent;
 * it (temporarily) uses all free space on the disk, so other
 concurrent write actions may fail.
 .
 Zerofree has been written to be run from GNU/Linux systems installed
 as guest OSes inside a virtual machine. If this is not your case, you
 almost certainly don't need this package. (One other use case would
 be to erase sensitive data a little bit more securely than with a
 simple "rm").</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>50</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>zip</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>3.0-11</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Archiver for .zip files
 This is InfoZIP's zip program. It produces files that are fully
 compatible with the popular PKZIP program; however, the command line
 options are not identical. In other words, the end result is the same,
 but the methods differ. :-)
 .
 This version supports encryption.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>573</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>zlib1g</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>compression library - runtime
 zlib is a library implementing the deflate compression method found
 in gzip and PKZIP. This package includes the shared library.</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Size" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>157</VALUE></PROPERTY></INSTANCE>

<INSTANCE CLASSNAME="MSFT_nxPackageResource"><PROPERTY NAME="Publisher" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="ReturnCode" TYPE="uint32"><VALUE>0</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Name" TYPE="string"><VALUE>zlib1g-dev</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="FilePath" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageGroup" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>false</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Installed" TYPE="boolean"><VALUE>true</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="InstalledOn" TYPE="string"><VALUE>Unknown</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Version" TYPE="string"><VALUE>1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Ensure" TYPE="string"><VALUE>present</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Architecture" TYPE="string"><VALUE>amd64</VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="Arguments" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageManager" TYPE="string"><VALUE></VALUE></PROPERTY><PROPERTY NAME="PackageDescription" TYPE="string"><VALUE>compression library - development
